summary: Of the 7 largest U.S. freight railroads, 6 have reported implementing "precision-scheduled railroading" (PSR), a strategy intended to increase efficiency and reduce costs. While there is no one definition of PSR, stakeholders told us this strategy is associated with fewer staff, longer trains, and more. For example, in 2022, all 7 of these railroads told us they ran longer trains with the goal of increasing...
title: Freight Rail: Information on Precision-Scheduled Railroading
